function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"High human toxicity and ecological concerns from the use of paris green for larviciding.","category":"Pollution increase","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of environmental management","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of gene drive mosquitoes could lead to unintended consequences in the ecosystem, such as the decline of other species or the emergence of new diseases.","category":"Biodiversity and ecological impacts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Release of wolbachia-carrying mosquitoes could unintentionally introduce new pathogens or disrupt the balance of existing microbial communities in the environment.","category":"Urbanization and habitat loss","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The use of spatial repellents in combating vector-borne diseases could lead to the development of resistance in mosquito populations, rendering the repellents ineffective.","category":"Environmental health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of chemical-based vector control tools may lead to environmental contamination and harm non-target species.","category":"Pollution increase","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Genetic manipulation of mosquitoes and other novel vector control tools may have unintended consequences on ecosystems and biodiversity.","category":"Biodiversity and ecological impacts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper disposal of coronavirus-related medical waste","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reuse of face masks made from coffee","category":"Wastewater and sanitation risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Failure to engage tourists in
